entry.title: Estupido idiota
entry.summary:
Author: BluethroatBird

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 22,579Chapters: 5/5Kudos: 24

Summary: He's alive. Dios mío, Buck is alive and breathing. He's standing right in front of him, even though he could be lying at the bottom of the gorge right now, right on the sharp peaks of the cliff. It didn't happen, but he could have. If Eddie hadn't been here with him, if they hadn't been soulmates, this would have happened. His chest aches with the realization. Eddie is frightened by how strong the pain is.

entry.title: Letters I didn't send
entry.summary:
Author: eliixbrown

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,023Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 11

Summary: When you were shot, part of me died. I was so scared Eddie. And look I know you don’t like me saying that it should have been me, but it should have been. Chris doesn’t deserve to grow up without you. So I would sacrifice myself every time if necessary. Sometimes when I think about what happened the taste of blood rushes through my mouth. Because I tasted your blood, and I know that I will never forget that taste. I’ve tasted your blood but not your lips. It kills me to even think about it.   Because it reminded me that losing you isn’t something I’d survive. Or: After Eddie leaves for El Paso Buck goes back to therapy and Dr Copeland gives him some homework.

entry.title: Happiness From Sorrow
entry.summary:
Author: RiversLastSong93

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,583Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 1

Summary: After Bobby’s death, Eddie finds himself drowning in what-ifs—the moments he let slip past him, the words he never said, and the feelings he kept locked away for far too long. In the quiet that grief leaves behind, those what-ifs turn into echoes, haunting him with the choices he didn’t make and the futures he never allowed himself to imagine. Losing Bobby sharpens everything: how fragile life is, how quickly it can change, and how little time any of them really have. Eddie can’t hide from the truth in his own heart anymore. Some feelings deserve to see the light… and some chances only come once.

entry.title: Just one more breath
entry.summary:
Author: CarpeDiem911

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 57,652Chapters: 20/?Kudos: 256

Summary: The hysterical laughter stole every coherent thought from Buck and crawled into his bones; his heart thudded and he stared at the doll in disbelief. Then, as suddenly as it had started, the laughter stopped; leaving an eerie silence. Buck stood frozen, his thoughts like thick mud, staring at that stupid doll. He completely missed the huge hole in the wall above the tub. He missed the shadow standing there, watching him from behind the hole with cold eyes and a malicious smile.

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 530,661Chapters: 58/?Kudos: 67

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 321,954Chapters: 51/?Kudos: 23

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: Nobody's Son
entry.summary:
Author: funnyfeelingbuckley

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 47,369Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 261

Summary: Buck’s phone starts ringing in his pocket. He sighs and checks the caller ID, staring in confusion at the unfamiliar number. “Uh, hello?” “Hello there, is this Evan Buckley?” A woman’s voice is heard through the phone. “May I ask who’s calling?” “My name is Hope Williams, from Child Protective Services. I was wondering if you had a moment to schedule a meeting on behalf of Charlotte Davis?” “I-I’m sorry, I think you must have called the wrong Evan Buckley. Who is Charlotte Davis?”   Or Buck finds out he has a 7-year-old daughter. Buck finds out a lot of stuff, actually. Title based on the Sabrina Carpenter song

entry.title: Underneath (the weight of the world)
entry.summary:
Author: Lothely

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 126,883Chapters: 13/14Kudos: 915

Summary: When he finally came back almost eight months after the ladder truck bombing, Buck hadn't expected a warm welcome from his teammates. But as their resentment towards his choice of suing the LAFD never wavers, he finds himself falling into a spiral of depression that could lead to severe consequences. The Earth never stops spinning on its axis, and just as the sun rises and sets every day and the moon reflects its light, the universe never stops forcing Buck to deal with new and old traumas. A visit from someone from Buck's past fundamentally changes the 118's views about their teammate, as old wounds are poked and left exposed, and everyone is forced to learn how to navigate their resentments and guilt.

entry.title: All The Ways We Became Us
entry.summary:
Author: bucknroll

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,882Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 2

Summary: When eight year old Evan Buckley is dragged from Pennsylvania to the dusty heat of El Paso, he expects to hate everything about it. Then he meets the boy next door, Eddie Diaz, all warm smiles, and quiet steadiness, and suddenly the world doesn’t feel so harsh anymore. They grow up side by side: shared bikes, late-night whispers, and promises they’re too young to understand. Or~ What if Buck and Eddie met when they were 8 years old.

entry.title: The Things We Never Stopped Being
entry.summary:
Author: ScribblesAfterDark

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,628Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 13

Summary: Divorce was supposed to bring clarity. Instead, it left Buck and Eddie sharing a roof, a child, and a gravitational pull they kept tripping over in the dark. What starts as a temporary arrangement slides back into old rhythms, then new ones, until the line between past and present blurs in ways neither of them are ready to name. This is the story of how almost getting back together feels a lot like never having stopped.

entry.title: Exhaustion Lines
entry.summary:
Author: 79KJ01

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,792Chapters: 15/20Kudos: 139

Summary: Buck hears the word once — in the wrong moment, in the wrong state of mind — and it sinks its teeth in. What should have been a passing comment twists into a truth he can’t shake, convincing him that everyone in his life is worn down by the weight of him. As he withdraws, slipping further into a quiet, dangerous spiral, the people who love him fight to remind him of one thing he can’t see on his own: he was never exhausting… only terrified of being left behind. Exhausting (adj.): not someone who is too much to love — but someone too important to lose.

entry.title: I'll be waiting here (Santa, that's my only wish this year)
entry.summary:
Author: DIANA55

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 494Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 11

Summary: Evelyn Buckley has a secret: she owns a ski resort in Aspenfall, Oregon—a place she’s returned to every Christmas, long before the 118 even knew. Now, with snow, sleds, cocoa, and her chaotic firehouse family in tow, Evelyn might discover that the holidays are for more than tradition… they’re for love, laughter, and the ones who truly feel like home.

entry.title: Myosotis: Searching For The Memories Of You
entry.summary:
Author: Epsylon_K

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,427Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 74

Summary: “Christopher has an imaginary friend.”"Something tells me that him having an imaginary friend is not the real problem.”“Not exactly, no.”“What’s the problem then?”“He believes that his friend is a real person who went missing.” The silence that enveloped them was heavy and Eddie took a few deep breaths. Or Chris has an imaginary friend and Buck is nowhere to be found, not even in people's memories

entry.title: How To Lose a Firefighter In Ten Days Off
entry.summary:
Author: Buddie_Butterflies

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 59,207Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 76

Summary: He walks past them and sits at the bar to order a round of shots, figuring that coming into the group that way might be a good icebreaker. He hasn’t ordered yet when he hears behind him, “Thanks for the shot.” he turns to see Captain Diaz standing by him, and Buck is confused “You're talking to me, Captain Diaz.” Buck smiles, trying to assess the situation. “It’s Eddie, and yes, you're the only one to buy me a shot.” He tells him, and Buck smiles. “Really, no one brought you a drink? I am surprised,” Buck says honestly. “Why is that, Buck?” Eddie asks, leaning against the counter. Was this man actually flirting with him? “Have you looked in the mirror, Diaz. Does anyone call you that?" Buck leans in. “Not if they want me to answer.” Eddie takes a sip of his beer, and Buck can’t take his eyes off him. “I look in mirrors every day, your point?” he shrugs and stares back. “You do know how beautiful you are, right?” Buck lays the charm on thick. “Is your full name Eduardo?”     OR How To Lose A Guy in Ten Days: Firefight Edition- loosely based on it, these two are so in love with each other and can't admit it.
